pages.text: Truly (worthy) to say nothing regarding Allah except the truth. I have already come to you with a supremely evident (sign) from your Lord, so send forth with me the Seeds (Or: sons) of ."Israel
Said he, "In case you have come with a sign, so come up with it, in case you are of the sincere
So he cast his staff, and only then was it an evident serpent
And he drew out his hand, and only then was it white to the on-lookers
The chiefs of Firaawn's (pharaoh's) people said, "Surely this is indeed a knowledgeable sorcerer
Who would (like to) drive you out of your land; so, what (is it that) you command
They said, "Put him off, and his brother, (a while) and send among the cities mutterers
(And) they will come up to you with every knowledgeable sorcerer
And the sorcerers came to Firaawn; they said, "Surely we will indeed have a reward in case we ourselves, are the over comers
Said he, "Yes, and surely you will indeed be among the near-stationed
They said, "O Musa! (Moses) Either you cast, or we ourselves will be the ones casting (first)
Said he, "You cast." So as soon as they cast, they bewitched (their) fellowmen?s eyes, and overawed them, and came with a tremendous sorcery
And We revealed to Musa (Moses) (saying), "Cast your staff." So, only then did it gulp whatever they falsified
So the Truth came to pass, (Literally: fell "on them") and void (Literally: became untrue) was whatever they were doing
So they were overcome over there, and they turned over belittled
And the sorcerers were cast down prostrating
